gov.fnal.ppd.signage.comm

Class DCProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.fnal.ppd.signage.comm.DCProtocol

  • public class DCProtocol
extends java.lang.Object
    DC stands for Display Communications This is the protocol for the messages between a Channel Changer and a Display.
    Author:
    Elliott McCrory, Fermilab

      • processInput

        public boolean processInput(DDMessage message,
                   int myDisplayNumber)

        There are two agents in this conversation

        • (client) -- the machine that tells the displays what to show asynchronous message from a human, or from a channel script. This client receives a "ready" message, and the it can send a URL to the server

        Maybe there should also be a protocol that allows the client to ask, "How are you doing?" To which the server replies with the URL it is showing.

        Parameters:
        message - The message to process
        myDisplayNumber -
        Returns:
        Was the processing successful?

      • getLastServerHeartbeat

        public long getLastServerHeartbeat()
        Returns:
        The timestamp of the last time we got a heart beat message from the server.
